title: America is at risk of high impact GPS jamming and spoofing from space
summary: “There is every reason to believe China’s BeiDou global navigation satellite system has the ability to imitate American GPS signals and those of Europe’s Galileo,” said Professor Todd Humphreys of […]

title: Environmentally sustainable space transport
summary: Ariane 6 cuts a vertical path up, up and away

title: SUAS Partners with T-Minus for Ireland’s First Commercial Rocket Launch
summary: Irish startup SUAS Aerospace has signed an agreement with T-Minus to perform Ireland’s first commercial rocket launch. SUAS Aerospace was founded in 2022 with the goal of developing a commercial launch facility on Irish soil capable of supporting suborbital and orbital rocket launches. To date, the company has raised an initial €1.1 million investment to […]

title: Introducing New Mexico’s Space Valley
summary: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. – New Mexican leaders in arts, academia and culture have joined forces to establish the SpaceValley Foundation, a nonprofit seeking to expand the state’s space innovation ecosystem. […]

title: Aerospace report recommends greater DOD support of commercial space capabilities
summary: The Defense Department should step up support of commercial space companies to take advantage of capabilities that might otherwise be lost, a new report concludes.

title: China’s Deep Blue Aerospace reveals suborbital tourism plans
summary: HELSINKI — Chinese launch startup Deep Blue Aerospace targets providing suborbital tourism flights starting in 2027. Deep Blue Aerospace is currently developing its Nebula-1 reusable orbital rocket and is preparing […]

title: Blue Origin conducts first flight of second human-rated New Shepard
summary: Blue Origin carried out the first flight of a new model of its New Shepard suborbital vehicle Oct. 23, a mission the company called “nominal and on target” despite going to a slightly lower altitude than past flights.

title: Crew-8 on the Way Home at Last
summary: Crew-8 undocked from the International Space Station this afternoon, two months later than planned. Their mission was extended first while NASA was deciding what to do about Boeing’s Starliner crew...

title: Boeing losses on Starliner increase by $250 million
summary: Boeing is taking another charge against earnings of $250 million on its CST-100 Starliner commercial crew program as the company’s new leader vowed it will not walk away from troubled programs like it.

title: SES-Intelsat combination’s far-reaching impact on deal-making
summary: The ripples from Intelsat’s $3.1 billion sale to rival satellite operator SES are disrupting and delaying deals for suppliers and other companies further downstream, according to finance experts on an Oct. 22 Satellite Innovation panel.
